newsitem.title: UK: Nynex nine month revenue up 91 percent.
newsitem.headline: Nynex nine month revenue up 91 percent.

text.p: Nynex CableComms Group announced a 91 percent increase in total revenue in the nine month period ended September 30, to 108.9 million stg.
The company also announced a 70 percent rise in its UK residential lines to 322,921 and a 47 percent increase in the number of its cable television customers to 242,867.

Nynex CableComms, franchised to provide Cable TV and telephone lines to 2.7 million homes in Britain, said 1.575 million homes have been passed compared with 1.066 million at the end of September 1995.
The company said that for the first time it produced positive operating cashflow of 2.2 million stg in the third quarter.

It said the strategy of reducing the price of phone calls has encouraged greater usage. Average revenue per line for the first nine months before costs were adjusted rose to 19.85 stg compared to 19.68 stg for the same period in 1995.
